text:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-a-drag-and-drop-area>
This link on that page leads to a 404 page. Fyi

404: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/templates/homepage.html>
Thank you for reporting this <@USRE524EA> I’ve corrected the documentation.

Does anyone have a decent solution for adding a bit of horizontal padding to DND modules? The caveat being it needs to be semi-selective.

I have a bunch of custom modules Pre DND that are still relevant and feature rich. A useful Full width image banner module with video capabilites for example.

Plopping it into a DND module and getting the section to style so that its full width is easy enough. But When it comes to mobile Id like ~15px of padding around all of the modules’ text content while still retaining FW BG colors and images.

I know I can target the .dnd-module class to add padding on mobile but that is global and then will result in squishing my BG image or video on a custom module.

Any one run into this and figure something decent out?
